title: How to Make a French 75 Jello Shot

steps.headline: Combine the water and the granulated sugar in a medium saucepan and bring the ingredients to a rolling boil.
Muddle the lemon wedges in a bowl.
Pour the lemon wedges and any juice and pulp released during muddling into the water and sugar mixture.
Reduce the heat to low and cover and simmer the syrup for 5 minutes.
Remove the syrup from the heat and pour it through a strainer into a bowl or jar.
steps.description: Allow the syrup to cool to room temperature before using it in the Jello shots.

steps.headline: Combine the lemon syrup and Prosecco in a medium saucepan.
Sprinkle gelatin over the top of the liquid and allow the gelatin to soak for 1 to 2 minutes.
Heat the saucepan over low heat, stirring for about 5 minutes with a whisk until the gelatin is completely dissolved.
Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the cognac.
Lightly spray a 1-pound (454 g) loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.
steps.description: The pan should measure approximately 8” by 4” (20 centimeters by 10 centimeters).

steps.headline: Pour the gelatin into the loaf pan.
steps.description: Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight until the gelatin has set.

steps.headline: Invert the loaf pan onto a cutting board.
steps.description: Using a sharp chef's knife that has been covered in cooking spray, cut the gelatin into small rectangles.

steps.headline: Place each rectangle onto a tray.
Serve the shot in a spoon garnished with a curl of lemon zest.

text: Make the Lemon Syrup Combine the water and the granulated sugar in a medium saucepan and bring the ingredients to a rolling boil.  Muddle the lemon wedges in a bowl.  Pour the lemon wedges and any juice and pulp released during muddling into the water and sugar mixture.  Reduce the heat to low and cover and simmer the syrup for 5 minutes.  Remove the syrup from the heat and pour it through a strainer into a bowl or jar. Allow the syrup to cool to room temperature before using it in the Jello shots. Make the Jello Shots Combine the lemon syrup and Prosecco in a medium saucepan.  Sprinkle gelatin over the top of the liquid and allow the gelatin to soak for 1 to 2 minutes.  Heat the saucepan over low heat, stirring for about 5 minutes with a whisk until the gelatin is completely dissolved.  Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the cognac.  Lightly spray a 1-pound (454 g) loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray. The pan should measure approximately 8” by 4” (20 centimeters by 10 centimeters). Pour the gelatin into the loaf pan. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight until the gelatin has set. Invert the loaf pan onto a cutting board. Using a sharp chef's knife that has been covered in cooking spray, cut the gelatin into small rectangles. Place each rectangle onto a tray.  Serve the shot in a spoon garnished with a curl of lemon zest.
